| A treasury golem:* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* is [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP. |                                                                                           |

A **treasury golem**, ', is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). The treasury golem is a [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") type of [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem") that is a stronger variation of the [gold golem](/wiki/Gold_golem "Gold golem"). In addition to the standard golem traits, it is [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious") and incapable of [regenerating](/wiki/Regenerating "Regenerating") [HP](/wiki/HP "HP"), and will seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem") and [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") to pick up.

A treasury golem has a weapon attack, a claw attack and a [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon, and possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance") like all golems, along with [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance").

## Generation

Treasury golems are not randomly generated, and normally-created treasury golems are always hostile. Treasury golems always generate with 60 HP.

The treasure rooms of [Nessus](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Nessus "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Nessus") in [Gehennom](/index.php?title=Gehennom_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gehennom (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") contain several treasury golems.

Treasury golems drop 2-8 random valuable gems and 299-400 gold pieces (dependent on the hero's [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck")) upon death [in place of a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").

## Encyclopedia entry

The treasury golem shares its entry with the gold golem:

The bellows he set away from the fire, and gathered all the tools  
wherewith he wrought into a silver chest; and with a sponge wiped  
he his face and his two hands withal, and his mighty neck and  
shaggy breast, and put upon him a tunic, and grasped a stout staff,  
and went forth halting; but there moved swiftly to support their  
lord handmaidens wrought of gold in the semblance of living maids.  
In them is understanding in their hearts, and in them speech and  
strength, and they know cunning handiwork by gift of the immortal  
gods.

\[ The Iliad, by Homer ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Treasury_golem\&action=edit)*

html:
Treasury golem

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
' treasury golem
Difficulty 16
Attacks Weapon 1d2 physical, Claw 2d6 physical, Breath weapon 4d6 poison
' treasury golem
Difficulty 16
Attacks

Weapon 1d2 physical, Claw 2d6 physical, Breath weapon 4d6 poison

Base level 12
Base experience 354
Speed 9
Base AC 0
Base MR 100
Alignment 9 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 0
Size large
Resistances sleep, poison, acid

A treasury golem:

  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • has a thick hide.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.

A treasury golem, ', is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. The treasury golem is a lawful type of golem that is a stronger variation of the gold golem. In addition to the standard golem traits, it is thick-skinned, amphibious and incapable of regenerating HP, and will seek out gold, gems and magical items to pick up.

A treasury golem has a weapon attack, a claw attack and a poisonous breath weapon, and possesses sleep resistance, poison resistance and death resistance like all golems, along with acid resistance.

Generation

Treasury golems are not randomly generated, and normally-created treasury golems are always hostile. Treasury golems always generate with 60 HP.

The treasure rooms of Nessus in Gehennom contain several treasury golems.

Treasury golems drop 2-8 random valuable gems and 299-400 gold pieces (dependent on the hero's luck) upon death in place of a corpse.

Encyclopedia entry

The treasury golem shares its entry with the gold golem:

The bellows he set away from the fire, and gathered all the tools
wherewith he wrought into a silver chest; and with a sponge wiped
he his face and his two hands withal, and his mighty neck and
shaggy breast, and put upon him a tunic, and grasped a stout staff,
and went forth halting; but there moved swiftly to support their
lord handmaidens wrought of gold in the semblance of living maids.
In them is understanding in their hearts, and in them speech and
strength, and they know cunning handiwork by gift of the immortal
gods.

[ The Iliad, by Homer ]
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''treasury golem''', {{yellow|'}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. The treasury golem is a [[lawful]] type of [[golem]] that is a stronger variation of the [[gold golem]]. In addition to the standard golem traits, it is [[thick-skinned]], [[amphibious]] and incapable of [[regenerating]] [[HP]], and will seek out [[gold]], [[gem]]s and [[magical item]]s to pick up.

A treasury golem has a weapon attack, a claw attack and a [[poisonous]] [[breath]] weapon, and possesses [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]] and [[death resistance]] like all golems, along with [[acid resistance]].

==Generation==
Treasury golems are not randomly generated, and normally-created treasury golems are always hostile. Treasury golems always generate with 60 HP.

The treasure rooms of [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Nessus|Nessus]] in [[Gehennom (dNetHack)|Gehennom]] contain several treasury golems.

Treasury golems drop 2-8 random valuable gems and 299-400 gold pieces (dependent on the hero's [[luck]]) upon death [[Corpseless|in place of a corpse]].

==Encyclopedia entry==
The treasury golem shares its entry with the gold golem:
